page.title: 03THE SOUTHLAKE AREA
page.content: Fifteen years ago the area which is now known as Thamesmead was marshland.It was a place where bombs could be brought for safe disposal and a place for gypsy encampments. Much of the housing consists of long terraces built of large concrete slabs.Many have a garage at ground level,with the living area above to minimise damage in the event of flooding. Also there are 12 tower blocks. Most houses can be reached by walkways, mainly above ground level, leading to Tavy Bridge where the shopping centre is situated. Also there is a Police Office, Lakeside Health Centre and nearby Newacres Library, The social centre is the Pyramid Club. There is a scarcity of leisure facilities,although man- made Southmere Lake is used by anglers, canoists and yachtsmen.The grassy areas are unsuitable for football or cricket.
